activities.loc: Monroe County Justice Center - Branch II

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's name. 
No contact with Brandon Borreson. 
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM. 
DEFENDANT MUST GO IMMEDIATELY TO THE JUSTICE PROGRAMS OFFICE UPON SIGNING OF BOND AND/OR RELEASE.  
THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM IS LOCATED IN THE MONROE COUNTY JUSTICE CENTER AT 112 SOUTH COURT STREET, ROOM 1008, SPARTA, WI. 
DEFENDANT MUST BE EQUIPPED WITH A GPS DEVICE THROUGH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.

Defendant Robert Dale Dockerty appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Skiles appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Caulum appears via zoom video. E. Weihe from Justice Department appears via zoom video. Court orders 50,000 cash bond with conditions.
